com.mojtaba.materialdatetimepicker.time

Interface TimePickerController

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TimePickerDialog

    public interface TimePickerController
    A collection of methods which need to be shared with all components of the TimePicker Created by mojtaba on 6/10/15.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getAccentColor() 
      boolean is24HourMode() 
      boolean isAmDisabled() 
      boolean isOutOfRange(Timepoint time, int index) 
      boolean isPmDisabled() 
      boolean isThemeDark() 
      Timepoint roundToNearest(Timepoint time, Timepoint.TYPE type)
      Will round the given Timepoint to the nearest valid Timepoint given the following restrictions: - TYPE.HOUR, it will just round to the next valid point, possible adjusting minutes and seconds - TYPE.MINUTE, it will round to the next valid point, without adjusting the hour, but possibly adjusting the seconds - TYPE.SECOND, it will round to the next valid point, only adjusting the seconds
      void tryVibrate()
      Request the device to vibrate

    • Method Detail

      • isThemeDark

        boolean isThemeDark()
        Returns:
        boolean - true if the dark theme should be used

      • is24HourMode

        boolean is24HourMode()
        Returns:
        boolean - true if 24 hour mode is used / false if AM/PM is used

      • getAccentColor

        int getAccentColor()
        Returns:
        int - the accent color currently in use

      • tryVibrate

        void tryVibrate()
        Request the device to vibrate

      • isOutOfRange

        boolean isOutOfRange(Timepoint time,
                     int index)
        Parameters:
        time - Timepoint - the selected point in time
        index - int - The current view to consider when calculating the range
        Returns:
        boolean - true if this is not a selectable value

      • isAmDisabled

        boolean isAmDisabled()
        Returns:
        boolean - true if AM times are outside the range of valid selections

      • isPmDisabled

        boolean isPmDisabled()
        Returns:
        boolean - true if PM times are outside the range of valid selections

      • roundToNearest

        Timepoint roundToNearest(Timepoint time,
                         Timepoint.TYPE type)
        Will round the given Timepoint to the nearest valid Timepoint given the following restrictions: - TYPE.HOUR, it will just round to the next valid point, possible adjusting minutes and seconds - TYPE.MINUTE, it will round to the next valid point, without adjusting the hour, but possibly adjusting the seconds - TYPE.SECOND, it will round to the next valid point, only adjusting the seconds
        Parameters:
        time - Timepoint - the timepoint to validate
        type - Timepoint.TYPE - whether we should round the hours, minutes or seconds
        Returns:
        timepoint - the nearest valid timepoint
